definition: to leave one's homeplace (to find work, flee disaster etc)
surname Li
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
country or countryside/native place/home village or town/township (PRC administrative unit)
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing
a well/CL:口[kou3]/neat/orderly

sentences.english: These soldiers were far away from home and often weren't paid for months.
sentences.chinese: 這些士兵離鄉背井，而且時常好幾個月都沒拿到薪俸。

sentences.english: Many thousands of people have been forced out of their homes and many schools have been taken over by militia.
sentences.chinese: 好幾千人被迫離鄉背井，許多學校被民兵佔據。

sentences.english: It is usually seen that people rent a house when studying or working away from home.
sentences.chinese: 離鄉背井到異地求學或工作，租房子是常有的經驗。

sentences.english: In war we must always leave room for strokes of fortune, and accidents that cannot be foreseen – Polybius.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭中我們爲謀取財富而離鄉背井，前途叵測。

sentences.english: Sharper even than this sadness was the fact that, for more than 30 years, she was an exile from her homeland.
sentences.chinese: 比這更悲慘的是她30多年離鄉背井，被迫流亡國外。

definition: to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
a remote and desolate place
to seek one's livelihood/to work to support oneself/to earn a living
to eke out a living/to live from hand to mouth/to drift aimlessly
linked in countless ways
wife and child
long and difficult trek
stranger
make light of traveling a thousand li/go to the trouble of traveling a long distance
travel-worn
lit. as close as lips and teeth (idiom); closely related/interdependent
poverty-stricken/poor
secure employment (lit. iron rice bowl)
(idiom) (of a good outcome) unanticipated/serendipitous/fortuitous
homeless
